summary.long: Jeremiah is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: These are the words of Jeremiah, the son of Hilkiah, one of the religious leaders at Anathoth in the land of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Word of the Lord came to Jeremiah in the days of Josiah, the son of Amon, king of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his rule.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came also in the days of Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, king of Judah, until the fifth month of the eleventh year of Zedekiah, the son of Josiah, king of Judah, when the people of Jerusalem were taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Word of the Lord came to me saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Before I started to put you together in your mother, I knew you. Before you were born, I set you apart as holy. I chose you to speak to the nations for Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “O, Lord God! I do not know how to speak. I am only a boy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to me, “Do not say, ‘I am only a boy.’ You must go everywhere I send you. And you must say whatever I tell you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be afraid of them. For I am with you to take you out of trouble,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord put out His hand and touched my mouth, and said to me, “See, I have put My words in your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have chosen you this day to be over the nations and the kings, to dig up and to pull down, to destroy and to throw down, to build and to plant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Word of the Lord came to me saying, “What do you see, Jeremiah?” I said, “I see a branch of an almond tree.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “You have seen well, for I am watching to see that My Word is completed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Word of the Lord came to me a second time saying, “What do you see?” And I said, “I see a boiling pot, with its face turned away from the north.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Out of the north trouble will come upon all the people of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For, see, I am calling all the families of the nations of the north,” says the Lord. “And they will come. Then every one will set up his throne at the gates of Jerusalem, and against all the walls around it, and against all the cities of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will tell how they are to be punished for all their sin. For they have turned away from Me and have given gifts to other gods, and worshiped the works of their own hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now get ready. Stand up and tell them everything that I tell you. Do not be afraid of them, or I will make trouble for you in front of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today I have made you as a strong city ready for war, as a pillar of iron and as walls of brass against the whole land, against the kings of Judah, the rulers, its religious leaders, and the people of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will fight against you. But they will not have power over you, for I am with you to take you out of trouble,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Word of the Lord came to me saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go and speak so those in Jerusalem will hear, ‘This is what the Lord says: “I remember how you loved Me when you were young. Your love was as a bride. I remember how you followed Me in the desert, through a land that had not been planted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel was holy to the Lord, the first-fruits of His gathering. All who ate of it (Israel) were guilty, and trouble came upon them,” says the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear the Word of the Lord, O family of Jacob, and all the families of the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord says, “What wrong did your fathers find in Me, that they turned so far from Me and followed false gods?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not say, ‘Where is the Lord Who brought us up from the land of Egypt? Where is He Who led us through the wilderness, through a land of deserts and deep holes, through a land without water and with much trouble, through a land that no one traveled and where no man lived?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I brought you into a rich land to eat its fruit and its good things. But you came and made My land unclean. You made the land I gave you sinful and hated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious leaders did not say, ‘Where is the Lord?’ And those who worked with the Law did not know Me. The rulers sinned against Me. And the men of God spoke by the false god of Baal, and went after things that did not help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So I will still fight with you,” says the Lord. “And I will fight your children’s children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go over to the land of Cyprus and see. Or send men to Kedar to watch with care. And see if there has been such a thing as this!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has a nation changed its gods, even when they are not gods? But My people have changed their greatness for that which does not help them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be full of wonder at this, O heavens. Shake with fear and waste away,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For My people have done two sinful things: They have turned away from Me, the well of living waters. And they have cut out of the rock wells for water for themselves. They are broken wells that cannot hold water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Is Israel a servant? Is he born as a servant? Why can he be taken away?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young lions have made noise against him. They have made a loud noise. And they have made his land a waste. His cities have been destroyed, and have no people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Memphis and Tahpanhes have broken the crown of your head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have you not brought this upon yourself, by turning away from the Lord your God, when He led you in the way?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now why are you going to Egypt to drink water from the Nile? Or why are you going to Assyria to drink water from the Euphrates?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your own sin will punish you. Your turning away from the Lord will punish you. So know and see that it is sinful and bitter for you to leave the Lord your God. You have no fear of Me,” says the Lord God of All.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Long ago I broke the load from your neck and tore off your chains. But you said, ‘I will not serve!’ For on every high hill and under every green tree you have lain down as a woman who sells the use of her body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet I planted you as a vine of much worth, in every way a true seed. How then have you turned away from Me and become a wild vine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even when you wash yourself with much strong soap, the mark of your sin is still before Me,” says the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How can you say, ‘I am clean. I have not gone after the false gods of Baal’? Look at what you did in the valley! Know what you have done! You are like a wild young camel wanting to mate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are a wild donkey used to the desert, that smells the wind in her desire. In the time of her mating who can turn her away? All who look for her will not become tired. In her month of mating they will find her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not run until your shoes wear out or until your mouth is dry. But you said, ‘It is of no use, for I love strange gods, and I will go after them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As a robber is put to shame when he is caught, so the family of Israel is put to shame: they, their kings, their rulers, their religious leaders, and their men of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They say to a tree, ‘You are my father,’ and to a stone, ‘You gave me birth.’ For they have turned their back to Me, and not their face. But in the time of their trouble they will say, ‘Rise up and save us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But where are your gods that you made for yourself? Let them come if they can save you when you are in trouble. For you have as many gods as cities, O Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do you complain against Me? You have all sinned against Me,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have punished your children for nothing, for they would not learn from it. Your sword has destroyed your men of God like a destroying lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O people of this day, listen to the Word of the Lord. Have I been a desert to Israel, or a land of much darkness? Why do My people say, ‘We are free to go, and we will come to You no more’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can a young woman forget the beautiful objects she wears? Can a bride forget her clothing? Yet My people have forgotten Me too many days to number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How you dress yourself and go after lovers! You have taught your ways even to the sinful women.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On your clothing is found the blood of the poor who could not be blamed. You did not find them breaking in. But even with all these things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you say, ‘I am not guilty. For sure He has turned His anger away from me.’ See, I will punish you because you say, ‘I have not sinned.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you go around so much changing your way? You will be put to shame by Egypt as you were put to shame by Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Egypt also you will go out with your hands on your head. For the Lord has turned against those in whom you trust, and as you are with them, it will not go well for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God says, “If a husband divorces his wife and she leaves him and marries another man, should he return to her again? Would not the land be made unclean? But you are like a sinful woman with many lovers, yet would you return to Me?” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lift up your eyes to the open hill-tops and see. Is there any place you have not lain with your lovers? You have sat by the roads waiting for them like an Arab in the desert. And you have made the land unclean with your sinful ways and your wrong-doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the rains have been held back. There has been no spring rain. You look like a woman who sells the use of her body, and would not be ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have you not just now called to Me? You said, ‘My Father, You have been my friend since I was young.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will You be angry forever? Will You be angry to the end?’ See, this is how you talk, but you do all the sinful things you can.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me in the days of King Josiah, “Have you seen what Israel did, and what little faith she has? She went up on every high hill and under every green tree, like one who sells the use of her body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I thought, ‘After she has done all these things, she will return to Me.’ But she did not return, and her sister Judah, who has not been faithful, saw it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She saw that for all of Israel’s sins and how she had not been faithful, I had sent her away and given her a paper of divorce. Yet her sister Judah had no fear, but she went and sold the use of her body also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because this sin was so easy for her, she sinned by worshiping stones and trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even with all this, her sister Judah did not return to Me with all her heart, but in a false way,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to me, “Israel, who has not been faithful, has shown herself more right and good than Judah who could not be trusted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go and make these words known to the north, saying, ‘Return, Israel, who has not been faithful,’ says the Lord. ‘I will not look on you in anger. For I show loving-kindness,’ says the Lord. ‘I will not be angry forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only know and tell of your guilt, that you have sinned against the Lord your God and have given your favors to the strangers under every green tree. Know that you have not obeyed My voice,’ says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Return, O sons who are not faithful,’ says the Lord. ‘For you belong to Me. I will take you, one from a city and two from a family, and I will bring you to Zion.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will give you shepherds after My own heart, who will feed you with much learning and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in those days when you have become many in the land,” says the Lord, “they will no more say, ‘The special box with the Law of the Lord.’ It will not come to mind, and they will not remember it. They will not miss it, and it will not be made again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time they will call Jerusalem ‘The throne of the Lord.’ And all the nations will gather in Jerusalem to honor the name of the Lord. They will not follow the strong-will of their sinful heart any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days the people of Judah will walk with the people of Israel. They will come together from the land of the north to the land that I gave your fathers as a gift.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then I said, ‘How I would like to make you My sons and give you a pleasing land, the most beautiful land of the nations!’ And I said, ‘You will call Me, “My Father,” and not turn away from following Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, as a woman is not faithful and leaves her husband, so you have not been faithful to Me, O people of Israel,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A voice is heard on the open hill-tops, the cries and prayers of the sons of Israel, because they have made their way sinful. They have forgotten the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Return, O sons who are not faithful. I will heal you and make you faithful.” “See, we come to You, for You are the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure the hills are a false hope, a noise on the mountains. In truth, the saving of Israel is in the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But false gods have brought us shame and have destroyed what our fathers worked for since we were young, their flocks and cattle, their sons and their daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us lie down in our shame, and let our shame cover us. For we and our fathers have sinned against the Lord our God ever since we were young. We have not obeyed the voice of the Lord our God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you will return, O Israel,” says the Lord, “return to Me. If you will put away your false gods from Me and be faithful to Me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and promise, ‘As the Lord lives,’ by what is true and right and good, then the nations will be happy in Him. And in Him they will have honor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord says to the men of Judah and Jerusalem, “Break up your ground which has not been planted, and do not plant seeds among thorns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set yourselves apart to the Lord, and put away the flesh from your heart, men of Judah and people of Jerusalem. Or My anger will go out like fire and burn with no one to stop it, because of the sinful things you do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make it known in Judah and Jerusalem, and say, “Sound the horns in the land.” Cry out and say, “Gather together, and let us go into the strong cities made ready for battle.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lift up a flag toward Zion! Run to a safe place, do not stand still. For I am bringing much trouble from the north that will destroy much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A lion has gone up from his secret place. A destroyer of nations has begun to move. He has gone out from his place to make your land a waste. Your cities will be destroyed and no people will live in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cover yourselves with cloth made from hair because of this. Cry out in sorrow. For the burning anger of the Lord has not turned away from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In that day,” says the Lord, “the heart of the king and the hearts of the rulers will become weak. The religious leaders will be filled with fear. And the men of God will be troubled and filled with wonder.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “O Lord God, for sure You have fooled these people and Jerusalem, saying, ‘You will have peace,’ when in truth a sword brings danger to their lives.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time it will be said to these people and Jerusalem, “A hot wind from the open hill-tops in the desert will come toward My people, but not to blow away what is of no worth, and not to make clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wind too strong for this will come at My word. Now I will bring punishment against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, he comes up like clouds. His war-wagons come like the strong-wind. His horses are faster than eagles. It is bad for us, for we are destroyed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wash your heart from sin, O Jerusalem, that you may be saved. How long will your sinful thoughts stay within you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a voice calls out from Dan, and tells of sin from Mount Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell it to the nations now! Make it known over all Jerusalem, saying, ‘An army is coming from a far country, and they lift up their voices against the cities of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are against her all around, like watchmen of a field, because she has turned against Me,’ says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Your ways and what you do have brought these things to you. This is your sin. How bitter it is! It has touched your very heart!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My soul, my soul! I am in pain! O, my heart! My heart is beating so hard! It cannot be quiet, for I hear the sound of the horn, telling of the coming war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: News of much trouble comes again and again, for the whole land is laid waste. All at once my tents and my curtains are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long must I see the flag and hear the sound of the horn?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For My people are foolish. They do not know Me. They are children who do not think, and they have no understanding. They know a lot about how to do sinful things, but they do not know how to do good.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I looked on the earth and saw that it was an empty waste. I looked to the heavens, and they had no light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I looked on the mountains and saw they were shaking, and all the hills moved this way and that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I looked and saw that there were no people. And all the birds of the heavens had left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I looked and saw that the rich land was a desert. All its cities were laid waste before the Lord and His burning anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord says, “The whole land will be laid waste, yet I will not destroy everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the earth will be filled with sorrow and the heavens above will be dark, because I have spoken. I have planned it, and will not change My mind or turn back.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every city runs as they hear the sound of the horseman and the one who fights with arrows. They go among the trees and the rocks. Every city is left empty, and no one lives in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, O destroyed one, what will you do? Even when you dress in red, and wear objects of gold, and color your eyes to make them look bigger, you make yourself beautiful for nothing. Your lovers hate you, and want to kill you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I heard a cry as of a woman in pain, as if she were giving birth to her first child. It was the cry of the people of Zion, working hard to breathe, holding out hands, and saying, “O, it is bad for me! I am losing strength in front of those who want to kill me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go up and down through the streets of Jerusalem, and look and learn. Look in her open places to see if you can find just one man who does what is right and looks for the truth. Then I will forgive this city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if they say, ‘As the Lord lives,’ for sure their promises are false.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord, do not Your eyes look for truth? You have punished them, but they were not sorry. You have destroyed them, but they would not change. They have made their faces harder than rock. They would not be sorry for their sins and turn from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “They are only the poor. They are foolish. For they do not know the way of the Lord or the Law of their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will go to the great men and will speak to them, for they know the way of the Lord, and the Law of their God.” But they too have broken the load from their neck and have broken the chains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So a lion from among the trees will kill them. A wolf of the deserts will destroy them. A leopard is watching their cities. Every one who goes out of them will be torn in pieces, because they have done many sins. They have turned away from the Lord in many ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why should I forgive you? Your sons have left Me and have sworn by those who are not gods. When I gave them everything they needed, they did sex sins and met at the house of the woman who sells the use of her body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were like well-fed horses full of sinful desire, each one wanting his neighbor’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should I not punish these people?” says the Lord. “Should I not make a nation such as this pay for its sins?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go up through her grape-fields and destroy, but do not destroy all of them. Cut away her branches, for they are not the Lord’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the people of Israel and the people of Judah have not been faithful to Me,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They have lied about the Lord and said, ‘He will do nothing. Nothing bad will happen to us, and we will not see sword or hunger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men who speak for God are only wind. The word is not in them. So let what they say be done to them!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord, the God of All, says, “Because you have said this, I am making My words in your mouth a fire and I am making these people wood so they will be burned up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I am bringing a nation that is far away against you, O people of Israel,” says the Lord. “It is a strong nation and an old nation, a nation whose language you do not know. You cannot understand what they say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their arrow-holder is like an open grave. All of them are powerful men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will eat up your food that you gather from your fields. They will eat the food your sons and your daughters should eat. They will eat up your flocks and your cattle. They will destroy your grape-fields and your fig trees. They will destroy with the sword your strong cities in which you trust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yet even in those days I will not make a complete end of you,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When your people say, ‘Why has the Lord our God done all these things to us?’ then you will say to them, ‘As you have left Me and served strange gods in your land, so you will serve strangers in a land that is not yours.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Make this known in the family of Jacob and in Judah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Hear this, O foolish people without understanding, who have eyes but do not see, who have ears but do not hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not fear Me?’ says the Lord. ‘Do you not shake in fear before Me? For I have placed the sand to be on one side of the sea, a lasting wall that it cannot cross. Even if there are waves, they cannot pass. Even if they make much noise, they cannot cross over it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But these people have a strong-will and a heart that has turned against Me. They have turned aside and gone away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They do not say in their heart, “Let us fear the Lord our God, Who gives rain in its time, both the fall rain and the spring rain, Who keeps for us the weeks for gathering food.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your wrong-doing has kept these good things away. Your sins have kept good from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sinful men are found among My people. They watch like men lying in wait watching for birds. They set a trap, and they catch men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like a basket full of birds, their houses are full of lies and false ways. So they have become important and rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are fat and smooth, and have done many sinful acts. They do not do what is right for those whose parents have died so that they may do well. And they do not help fight for the rights of the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Should I not punish these people?” says the Lord. “Should I not punish a nation such as this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A very bad and surprising thing has happened in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of God say things that are not true, and the religious leaders rule by their own thoughts. And My people love to have it this way! But what will you do in the end?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Run away to be safe, O sons of Benjamin! Run from Jerusalem! Blow the horn in Tekoa, and light a fire in Beth-haccerem. For a sinful power is coming down from the north, that will destroy much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will cut off the beautiful and fine ones, the people of Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shepherds and their flocks will come to her. They will set up their tents around her and feed their flocks there, each in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make war against her. Rise up, let us go and fight her at noon. It is bad for us, for the day is passing! The shadows of the evening are longer!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rise up, let us go and fight in the night and destroy her strong houses!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord of All says, “Cut down her trees, and build a battle-wall against Jerusalem. This is the city to be punished. There is nothing but a sinful power that makes hard times for others within her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a well keeps its water good for drinking, so Jerusalem keeps going on in her sin. The sounds of those who fight and those who destroy are heard in her. Sickness and sorrow are always before Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen about the danger, O Jerusalem, or I will become a stranger to you. I will make you a waste, a land with no people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord of All says, “They will gather all the people of Israel who are left like gathering from the vine. Pass your hand over the branches again like one who gathers grapes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whom should I tell of the danger, that they may hear? See, their ears are closed and they cannot listen. They have become ashamed of the Word of the Lord. They have no joy in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I am full of the anger of the Lord. I am tired of holding it in. “Pour it out on the children in the street, and on the young men gathered together. For both husband and wife will be taken, the old and those who have lived a very long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their houses, their fields and their wives will be given to others. I will put out My hand against the people of the land,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For from the least to the greatest of them, every one is always wanting something. And from the man of God to the religious leader, every one lies to get what he wants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have healed the hurt of My people only a little, saying, ‘Peace, peace,’ when there is no peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Were they ashamed because of the sinful things they had done? No, they were not ashamed at all. They did not even know how to turn red. So they will fall among those who fall. When I punish them, they will be brought down,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord says, “Stand by where the roads cross, and look. Ask for the old paths, where the good way is, and walk in it. And you will find rest for your souls. But they said, ‘We will not walk in it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I set watchmen over you, saying, ‘Listen to the sound of the horn!’ But they said, ‘We will not listen.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So hear, O nations, and know, O people, what will happen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear, O earth. See, I am bringing much trouble upon these people. It is the fruit of their plans, because they have not listened to My words. And they have turned away from My law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why does special perfume come to Me from Sheba, or sweet spices from a far away land? I will not receive your burnt gifts on the altar in worship. The gifts you give on the altar are not pleasing to Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord says, “See, I am laying things in front of these people, and they will fall over them. Fathers and sons will fall together, and neighbor and friend will die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord says, “See, a people is coming from the north country. A great nation is being raised up from the farthest parts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They take hold of bow and spear. They are hard on people and have no pity. Their voice sounds like the sea. They ride on horses, dressed as a man for battle against you, O people of Zion!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have heard about it. Our hands fall weak. Suffering has taken hold of us, like the pain of a woman giving birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not go out into the field, and do not walk on the road. For the one who hates us has a sword. Fear is all around us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O daughter of my people, dress in cloth made from hair and roll in ashes. Have sorrow as if you lost your only son. Cry with a bitter cry. For all at once the destroyer will come upon us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have asked you to test My people, that you may know and test their ways.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of them are strongwilled in turning to their own way, going about telling stories to hurt people. They are brass and iron. All of them are sinful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Air is blown hard on the fire to burn up the lead. It is of no use because the sinful ones are not taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are called waste silver, because the Lord has turned away from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This word came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Stand in the gate of the Lord’s house and make this word known: ‘Hear the Word of the Lord, all you men of Judah who go through these gates to worship the Lord!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord of All, the God of Israel, says, “Change your ways and your works for the better, and I will let you live in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not trust the lies that say, ‘This is the house of the Lord, the house of the Lord, the house of the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you for sure change your ways and what you do for the better, if you are fair as you judge between a man and his neighbor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you do not make it hard for the stranger from another land, or the child whose parents have died, or the woman whose husband has died, and do not kill those who are not guilty in this place, and stop going after other gods, for that will destroy you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will let you live in this place, in the land that I gave to your fathers forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, you are trusting in lies which cannot help you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will you steal, kill, do sex sins, make false promises, give gifts to the false god Baal, and go after other gods that you have not known,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then come and stand before Me in this house which is called by My name, and say, ‘We are safe and free!’ and still do all these hated sins?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has this house which is called by My name become a place of robbers in your eyes? See, I Myself have seen it,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But go now to the place in Shiloh where I first made a place for My name. And see what I did to it because of the sin of My people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you have done all these things,” says the Lord. “I spoke to you again and again, but you did not hear. I called you but you did not answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So as I did to Shiloh, I will do to the house that is called by My name and in which you trust, and to the place that I gave you and your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send you away from My eyes, as I have sent away all your brothers, all the children of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for you, do not pray for these people. Do not lift up a cry or prayer for them. Do not speak with Me about them, for I do not hear you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not see what they are doing in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children gather wood. The fathers make the fire. And the women make bread and cakes for the queen of heaven. They pour out drink gifts to other gods to make Me angry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do they make Me angry?” says the Lord. “Is it not themselves they hurt, to their own shame?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord God says, “See, My anger will be poured out on this place, on man and animal, on the trees of the field and on the fruit of the ground. It will burn and not be stopped.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord of All, the God of Israel, says, “Add your burnt gifts to the animals you kill on the altar, and eat the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when I brought your fathers out of the land of Egypt, I did not speak to them or tell them what to do about burnt gifts and animals killed on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I did tell them, ‘Obey My voice, and I will be your God, and you will be My people. Walk in all the way that I tell you, that it may be well with you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they did not obey or listen, but walked in the way they wanted to and in the strong-will of their sinful heart. They only stepped back and did not go on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since the day that your fathers came out of the land of Egypt until this day, I have sent you all My servants who speak for Me. I have risen up early and sent them day after day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they did not listen to Me or turn their ear to Me, but made their neck hard. They sinned more than their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You will speak all these words to them, but they will not listen to you. You will call to them, but they will not answer you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will say to them, ‘This is the nation that did not obey the voice of the Lord their God or receive His strong teaching. They have lost the truth. It has been cut off from their mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cut off your hair and throw it away. And cry in sorrow on the open hill-tops. For the Lord has turned away and left the people who made Him angry.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the sons of Judah have done what is sinful in My eyes,” says the Lord. “They have put their hated things in the house that is called by My name, to make it unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they have built the high places of Topheth, in the valley of the son of Hinnom, to burn their sons and daughters in the fire. I did not tell them to do this. It did not come into My mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the days are coming,” says the Lord, “when it will not be called Topheth any more, or the valley of the son of Hinnom. But it will be called the valley of Killing. For they will bury in Topheth because there is no other place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The dead bodies of these people will be food for the birds of the sky and for the wild animals of the earth. And no one will send them away in fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, I will put an end to the voice of joy and the voice of happiness, the voice of the man to be married and the voice of the bride. For the land will become a waste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time,” says the Lord, “they will bring out the bones of the kings and leaders of Judah, the bones of the religious leaders, the bones of the men of God, and the bones of the people of Jerusalem from their graves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will spread them out to the sun, the moon, and to all the stars of heaven. For these they have loved, and served, and followed, and looked for, and worshiped. The bones will not be gathered or buried. They will be as animal waste on top of the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And death will be chosen instead of life by all those who are left of this sinful family in all the places where I have driven them,” says the Lord of All.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You will say to them, ‘This is what the Lord says: “Do men fall and not get up again? Does one turn away and not return?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why then have the people of Jerusalem always turned away from Me? They hold on to what is false, and will not return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have listened and heard, but they have not said what is right. No man turned from his sinful way, saying, ‘What have I done?’ Every one turns to his own way like a horse running into battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even the stork in the sky knows her times. And the turtle-dove, crane, and swallow keep the time of their coming. But My people do not know the Law of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How can you say, ‘We are wise, and the Law of the Lord is with us’? See, the lying hand of the writers has made it into a lie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wise men are put to shame. They are troubled and taken. See, they have turned away from the Word of the Lord, and what kind of wisdom do they have?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will give their wives to others, and their fields to new owners. Because from the least to the greatest, every one is always wanting much. From the man of God to the religious leader, no one can be trusted in what he does.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have healed the hurt of My people very little, saying, ‘Peace, peace,’ when there is no peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Were they ashamed because of the hated sin they had done? They were not ashamed at all. They did not even know how to turn red. So they will fall among those who fall. When I punish them, they will be put down,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For sure I will take them away,” says the Lord. “There will be no grapes on the vine, and no figs on the fig tree, and the leaves will dry up. What I have given them will pass away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why are we sitting here? Gather together, and let us go into the strong cities and die there. For the Lord our God has given us up to die. He has given us poison in our water to drink, for we have sinned against Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We waited for peace, but no good came. We waited for a time of healing, but see, there is much trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The noise of his horses is heard from Dan. The whole land shakes at the sound of his war horses. For they come and destroy the land and everything that is in it, the city and those who live in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For see, I am sending the worst of snakes against you, poison snakes which cannot be stopped. And they will bite you,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My sorrow is too much to heal. My heart is weak within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen! It is the cry of my people from a far away land: “Is the Lord not in Zion? Is her King not in her?” “Why have they made Me angry with their objects of worship, and with strange gods?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Gathering time is past, summer is ended, and we are not saved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am hurt because my people are hurt. I am filled with sorrow, and fear has taken hold of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is there no healing oil in Gilead? Is there no doctor there? Why then have my people not been healed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If only my head were a well of water, and my eyes a well of tears, that I might cry day and night for my people who have been killed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If only I had a place in the desert for travelers to stay, that I might leave my people, and go away from them! For none of them are faithful. They are a gathering of men who cannot be trusted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They use their tongue like their bow. Lies, and not truth, rule the land. For they go from sin to sin, and they do not know Me,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let every one watch his neighbor. Do not trust any brother. Because every brother sets traps, and every neighbor goes about hurting people with his talk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every one fools his neighbor, and does not tell the truth. They have taught their tongue to tell lies. They become tired doing so many sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You live in the center of false ways. In their false ways they are not willing to know Me,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord of All says, “See, I will make them pure and test them. For what else can I do with My people?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their tongue is an arrow that kills. It lies. A man speaks peace to his neighbor with his mouth, but in his heart he plans to trap him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should I not punish them for these things?” says the Lord. “Should I not make a nation such as this pay for its sins?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will cry with a loud voice for the mountains. I will cry out in sorrow for the fields, because they are laid waste. No one passes through them. The sound of the cattle is not heard. The birds of the sky and the wild animals have run away. They are gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will break down Jerusalem into pieces, a place where wild dogs live. And I will lay waste the cities of Judah. No people will live there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is the man wise enough to understand this? To whom has the mouth of the Lord spoken, that he may make it known? Why is the land destroyed and laid waste like a desert, so that no one passes through?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said, “They have turned away from My Law that I have given them. They have not obeyed My voice and would not be led by it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they have followed the strongwill of their own hearts, and have gone after the false gods of Baal, as their fathers taught them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord of All, the God of Israel, says, “See, I will feed these people with wormwood and put poison in their drinking water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will spread them out among the nations whom they and their fathers have not known. And I will go after them with the sword until I have put an end to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord of All says, “Take thought and call for the women who are filled with sorrow, that they may come. Call for the women who cry for the dead, that they may come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them hurry and cry in a loud voice for us, that tears may come from our eyes, and that our eyes will flow with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a sound of loud crying is heard from Zion: ‘How we are destroyed! We are filled with shame, for we have left the land because they have broken down our houses.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now hear the Word of the Lord, O you women. Let your ear receive the Word of His mouth. Teach your daughters a song of sorrow. Every one teach her neighbor a song for the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For death has come in through our windows. It has come into our beautiful houses of kings. It has cut off the children from the streets, and the young men from the open spaces of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say, “This is what the Lord says: ‘The dead bodies of men will fall like animal waste on the open field, and like grain after the gatherer. But no one will gather them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord says, “Let not a wise man speak with pride about his wisdom. Let not the strong man speak with pride about his strength. And let not a rich man speak with pride about his riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But let him who speaks with pride speak about this, that he understands and knows Me, that I am the Lord who shows loving-kindness and does what is fair and right and good on earth. For I find joy in these things,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, the days are coming,” says the Lord, “when I will punish all who have gone through the religious act of the Jews, but have not had the sin cut from their heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will punish Egypt, Judah, Edom, the sons of Ammon, Moab, and all those who live in the desert. For none of these nations have had their flesh cut. And none of the people of Israel have had the sin cut from their heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear the word which the Lord speaks to you, O people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord says, “Do not learn the way of the nations. And do not be afraid of the things seen in the heavens, even if the nations are afraid of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the ways of the people are of no use. They cut wood from the trees. A workman cuts it with an ax.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They make it beautiful with silver and gold. They put it together with nails so that it cannot fall apart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their false gods are like a wooden man set up in a vegetable field to make birds be afraid and stay away. They cannot speak. They must be carried, because they cannot walk. Do not be afraid of them, for they cannot hurt you. And they cannot help you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no one like You, O Lord. You are great, and Your name is great in power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who would not fear You, O King of the nations? For You should be honored with fear. Among all the wise men of the nations, and in all their lands, there is no one like You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are all poor thinkers and foolish. What can they learn from a false god of wood?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beaten silver is brought from Tarshish, and gold from Uphaz. They are the work of an able workman and of one who works with gold. Their clothing is blue and purple. They are all the work of able workmen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord is the true God. He is the living God and the King Who lives forever. The earth shakes at His anger. And the nations cannot last when He is angry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you should say to them: “The gods that did not make the heavens and the earth will be destroyed from the earth and from under the heavens.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is He Who made the earth by His power, and the world by His wisdom. By His understanding He has spread out the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He speaks, there is a storm of waters in the heavens. He makes the clouds rise from the ends of the earth. He makes lightning for the rain, and brings out the wind from His store-houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every man is a poor thinker and without learning. Every one who works with gold is put to shame by his false gods. For his objects of worship fool people. There is no breath in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are without worth, and make fun of the truth. In the time of their punishment, they will be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He Who is the God of Jacob is not like these, for He has made all things. And Israel is His chosen family. The Lord of All is His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pick up your load from the ground, you who are shut in by armies!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord says, “See, I am throwing out the people of the land at this time. And I will trouble them, that they may feel it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is bad for me because I am hurt! My sore cannot be healed. But I said, “For sure this sickness is mine, and I must suffer with it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My tent is destroyed and all my ropes are broken. My sons have gone from me and are no more. There is no one to put up my tent again or to set up my curtains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the shepherds are poor thinkers and have not asked for the Lord’s help. So they have not done well, and all their flock is sent different places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen, the sound of news! See, it comes! Much noise of moving is coming out of the land of the north to destroy the cities of Judah, and to make it a place where wild dogs live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord, I know that a man’s way is not known by himself. It is not in man to lead his own steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Punish me when I need it, O Lord, but be fair. Do not punish me in Your anger, or You will bring me to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pour out Your anger on the nations that do not know You, and on the families that do not call on Your name. For they have destroyed Jacob. They have destroyed him and have laid waste his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear the words of this agreement, and speak to the men of Judah and the people of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to them, ‘This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: “Cursed is the man who does not listen to the words of this agreement
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which I told to your fathers before you when I brought them out of the land of Egypt. I brought them from the land that was like an iron stove. I said to them, ‘Listen to My voice, and do all that I tell you. Then you will be My people and I will be your God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so I will keep the promise I made to your fathers before you, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as it is this day.”’” Then I answered and said, “Let it be so, O Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me, “Make these words known in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying, ‘Hear the words of this agreement and do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by My strong words I told your fathers of the danger when I brought them up from the land of Egypt. I kept telling them even to this day, saying, “Listen to My voice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they did not obey or listen. Every one walked in his own strong-will because of his sinful heart. So I brought upon them all the words of this agreement, which I told them to do, but they did not.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Sinful plans have been made by the men of Judah and the people of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have returned to the sins of their fathers before them who would not listen to My words. And they have gone to serve other gods. The people of Israel and Judah have broken the agreement I made with their fathers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord says, “See, I am bringing much trouble on them. They will not be able to get away from it. Even when they cry to Me, I will not listen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the cities of Judah and the people of Jerusalem will go and cry to the gods to whom they burn special perfume. But they cannot save them in the time of their trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For your gods are as many as your cities, O Judah. And your altars you have set up to burn special perfume to the false god Baal are as many as the streets of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So do not pray for these people. Do not lift up a cry or prayer for them. For I will not listen when they call to Me because of their trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What right has My loved one to be in My house when she has done many sinful acts? Can animals killed on My altar take your trouble away from you? Can you then find joy?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord called you, “A green olive tree, beautiful and with good fruit.” But with a noise like thunder He set fire to it, and its branches were destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord of All, Who planted you, has said that bad will come to you because of the sin of the people of Israel and of the people of Judah. They have done wrong to make Me angry by burning special perfume to the false god Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord made it known to me and I knew it. You showed me the sinful things they did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I was like a gentle lamb led to be killed. I did not know that they had made plans against me, saying, “Let us destroy the tree with its fruit. Let us cut him off from the land of the living, that his name be remembered no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But, O Lord of All, Who is right as He judges, Who tests the heart and the mind, let me see You punish them. For I have put my cause before You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord speaks about the men of Anathoth who want to kill you. These men say, “Do not speak in the name of the Lord, or you will die by our hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord of All says, “See, I am about to punish them! The young men will die by the sword. And their sons and daughters will die from hunger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of them will be left. For I will bring much trouble to the men of Anathoth, in the year of their punishment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are right and good, O Lord, when I complain to You about my trouble. Yet I would like to talk with You about what is fair. Why does the way of the sinful go well? Why do all those who cannot be trusted have it so easy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have planted them, and they have taken root. They grow and have given fruit. You are near on their lips but far from their heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But You know me, O Lord. You see me. And You test how my heart is with You. Take them off like sheep to be killed. Set them apart for the day of killing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long will the land be filled with sorrow? How long will the grass of every field dry up? For the sin of those who live in it, animals and birds have been taken away, because men have said, “He will not see what happens to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you have run with men on foot and they have made you tired, then how can you run as fast as horses? If you fall down in a land of peace, how will you do among all the trees beside the Jordan?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even your brothers and those of your father’s house have not been faithful to you. They have cried to you in a loud voice. Do not believe them, even if they say pleasing things to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have left My house. I have left My chosen nation. I have given the loved one of My soul into the hand of those who hate her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My chosen nation has become to Me like a lion among the trees. She has raised her voice against Me, so I hate her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is My chosen nation like a spot-covered, flesh-eating bird to Me? Are the flesh-eating birds against her on every side? Go, gather all the wild animals of the field, and bring them to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many shepherds have destroyed My grape-field. They have crushed My field under foot. They have turned My good field to an empty desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It has been laid waste. Destroyed and empty, it cries with sorrow before Me. The whole land has been laid waste, because no one cares.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On all the open hill-tops in the desert, destroyers have come. For the sword of the Lord destroys from one end of the land to the other. There is no peace for anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have planted grain and have gathered thorns. They have worked hard, but have nothing. Be ashamed of what you gather because of the burning anger of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says about all My sinful neighbors who take the gift I have given to My people Israel: “See, I am about to pull them up by the roots from their land. And I will pull up the people of Judah by the roots from among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after I have pulled them up by the roots, I will have loving-pity on them again, and will bring them back. I will return each one to what he has been given and to his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then if they will for sure learn the ways of My people, and promise by My name, ‘As the Lord lives,’ even as they taught My people to promise by Baal, then they will be built up among My people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they will not listen, then I will pull that nation up by the roots and destroy it,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me, “Go and buy a linen belt, and put it around yourself. But do not put it in water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I bought the belt as the Lord had said and put it around me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Word of the Lord came to me a second time, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the belt that you have bought and are wearing, get up, and go to the Euphrates. Hide it there in a hole in the rock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I went and hid it by the Euphrates, as the Lord had told me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After many days the Lord said to me, “Get up and go to the Euphrates and get the belt which I told you to hide there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I went to the Euphrates and dug, and I took the belt from the place where I had hidden it. And I saw that the belt was worth nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord says: ‘In this way I will destroy the pride of Judah and the great pride of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These sinful people would not listen to My words. They walk in the strong-will of their own hearts and have gone to serve and worship other gods. So let them be just like this linen belt, which is good for nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the belt holds on to a man’s body, so I made the whole family of Israel and the whole family of Judah hold on to Me,’ says the Lord. ‘This was so that they might be for Me a people, a name, a praise, and an honor. But they would not listen.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So you are to tell this to them: ‘The Lord, the God of Israel, says, “Every jar is to be filled with wine.”’ And when they say to you, ‘Do we not know very well that every jar is to be filled with wine?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then tell them, ‘The Lord says, “I am about to fill all the people of this land, the kings who sit on David’s throne, the religious leaders, the men of God, and all the people of Jerusalem with too much drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will throw them against each other, both the fathers and sons together,” says the Lord. “I will not let pity or sorrow or loving-kindness keep Me from destroying them.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen and hear. Do not be proud, for the Lord has spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give honor to the Lord your God before He brings darkness and before you slip and fall on the dark mountains. You hope for light, but He will turn it into darkness and it will be very dark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you will not listen, my soul will cry in secret because of your pride. My eyes will cry with a bitter cry and tears will flow down, because the Lord’s people have been taken away in chains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to the king and the queen mother, “Come down from your throne. Your beautiful crown has been taken from your head.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cities of the Negev have been locked up, and there is no one to open them. All Judah has been taken away. All the people of Judah have been taken to another land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Look up and see those who are coming from the north. Where is the flock that was given to you, your beautiful sheep?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What will you say when He sets over you those whom you have taught and who were your friends? Will not pain take hold of you, like a woman giving birth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you say in your heart, ‘Why have these things happened to me?’ It is because of your many sins that your clothing has been torn off and you suffer punishment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can the Ethiopian change his skin or the leopard his spots? Then you also can do good who are used to doing wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will cause you to go everywhere like straw blown by the desert wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you get, the share given to you from Me,” says the Lord, “because you have forgotten Me and trusted in lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will pull your clothing up over your face, that your shame may be seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for your sex sins and cries of desire, your sinful sex acts on the hills in the field, I have seen your hated sins. It is bad for you, O Jerusalem! How long will you be unclean?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Word of the Lord which came to Jeremiah when there was no water:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Judah is full of sorrow and her gates are weak. Her people sit on the ground in sorrow, and a cry goes up from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their men of honor have sent their servants for water. They have come to the wells and found no water, and returned with their jars empty. They have been put to shame and troubled, and covered their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ground is dried up because there has been no rain on the land. The farmers have been put to shame and have covered their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even the deer in the field leaves her young one which has just been born, because there is no grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wild donkeys stand on the open hill-tops. They breathe hard for air like wild dogs. Their eyes become weak because there is nothing to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Even when our sins speak against us, O Lord, do something for the good of Your name. For we have fallen away from You many times. We have sinned against You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are the Hope of Israel, the One Who saves it in time of trouble. Why are You like a stranger in the land? Why are You like a traveler who has set up his tent for the night?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why are You like a man surprised, like a strong man who cannot save? Yet You are among us, O Lord, and we are called by Your name. Do not leave us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord says this about these people, “They have loved to go their own way. They have not held their feet back. So the Lord is not pleased with them. Now He will remember their wrong-doing and punish their sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me, “Do not pray for the well-being of these people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they go without food, I will not listen to their cry. And when they give burnt gifts and grain gifts, I will not receive them. But I will destroy them by the sword, hunger and disease.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “O Lord God, the ones who speak in Your name are telling them, ‘You will not see the sword and you will not go hungry. But I will give you lasting peace in this place.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Those men are speaking lies in My name. I have not sent them, or told them, or spoken to them. They are telling you a false dream of a false future that means nothing. They are speaking the lies of their own hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So this is what the Lord says about those men who tell what is going to happen in the future using My name. I did not send them, yet they keep saying, ‘There will be no sword or hunger in this land.’ So by the sword and by hunger those false teachers will be destroyed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people they tell these things to will be thrown out into the streets of Jerusalem because of hunger and the sword. There will be no one to bury them, or their wives, or their sons, or their daughters. For I will pour out their own sin upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will say to them, ‘Let my eyes flow with tears without stopping night and day. For my people have been crushed with a very hard beating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I go out to the country, I see those killed by the sword! Or if I go into the city, I see diseases because of hunger! For both the man who speaks for God and the religious leader have gone around and around in the land they do not know.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have You nothing at all to do with Judah any more? Do You hate Zion? Why have You punished us so that we cannot be healed? We waited for peace, but nothing good came. We waited for a time of healing, but there is much trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that we are sinful, O Lord, and we know the sin of our fathers. For we have sinned against You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the good of Your name do not hate us. Do not put to shame the throne of Your shining-greatness. Remember and do not break Your agreement with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are there any among the false gods of the nations who give rain? Or can the heavens give rain? Is it not You, O Lord our God? So we hope in You. For You are the One Who has done all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Even if Moses and Samuel were to stand before Me, My heart would not be with these people. Send them away from Me and let them go!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they ask you, ‘Where should we go?’ then tell them, ‘The Lord says, “Those who are to die, to death, and those who are to be killed by the sword, to the sword. Those who are to go hungry, to hunger, and those who are to be taken away as prisoners, to be taken away.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will set over them four kinds of destroyers,” says the Lord: “The sword to kill, the dogs to take away, and the birds of the sky and the wild animals of the earth to eat and destroy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make them an object of much fear and hate among all the nations of the earth because of Manasseh, the son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, for what he did in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who will have pity on you, O Jerusalem, or who will have sorrow for you? Who will turn aside to ask about your well-being?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have turned away from Me,” says the Lord. “You keep going back into sin. So I will put out My hand against you and destroy you. I am tired of having pity on you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will throw them to the wind like straw at the gates of the land. I will take their children from them. I will destroy My people. For they did not turn from their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their women whose husbands have died will be as many as the sand of the seas. At noon I will bring a destroyer against the mothers of young men. I will bring suffering and fear to them all at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She who gave birth to seven sons will become weak and die. Her sun will set while it is still day, and she will be put to shame. I will give the rest of them to the sword in front of those who hate them,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is bad for me, my mother, that you have given birth to me! I am a man of trouble and fighting to all the land. No one owes money to me, and I do not owe money to others, yet every one curses me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “For sure I will set you free for a good reason. For sure I will make those who hate you ask of you in times of trouble and suffering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Can anyone crush iron, iron from the north, or brass?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give your money and riches to those who fight against you, without a price, because of all your sins in all your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make those who hate you bring your riches into a land you do not know. For My anger has started a fire that will burn you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord, You understand. Remember me and visit me. And punish those who make it hard for me. Do not take me away, for You are slow to be angry. Know that because of You I suffer and am put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your words were found and I ate them. And Your words became a joy to me and the happiness of my heart. For I have been called by Your name, O Lord God of All.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I did not sit with those who were having fun, and I was not full of joy. I sat alone because Your hand was upon me. For You had filled me with hate for their sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why is there no end to my pain? And why will my hurt not be healed? Will You be to me like a river that flows with water some of the time and is dry at other times?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord says, “If you return, then I will let you take your place again, standing before Me. And if you take out what is of worth from what is of no worth, then you will speak for Me. Let these people turn to you, but you must not turn to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will make you like a strong wall of brass to these people. Even if they fight against you, they will not get power over you. For I am with you to save you and bring you out of trouble,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will take you from the hand of the sinful. And I will free you from the hand of those who would hurt you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not get married or have sons or daughters in this place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord says about the sons and daughters born in this land, and about their mothers who give birth to them, and their fathers who gave them life in this land:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They will die of bad diseases. No one will cry for them or bury them. They will be as animal waste on the ground, destroyed by sword and hunger. Their dead bodies will become food for the birds of the sky and for the wild animals of the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord says, “Do not go into a house where the people have lost a loved one. Do not go to cry or to comfort them. For I have taken My peace, My loving-kindness and My pity from these people,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Both great men and small will die in this land. They will not be buried. No one will cry for them. And no one will cut himself or cut off his hair for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one will give food to comfort those who sorrow for the dead. And no one will give them the cup of comfort to drink even for the death of their father or mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not go into a house where they are eating much and sit with them to eat and drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord of All, the God of Israel, says, “Before your eyes and in your time, I am going to bring an end to the voice of joy, the voice of happiness, the voice of the man to be married and the voice of the bride in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you tell these people all these words, they will say to you, ‘Why has the Lord said all these bad things will happen to us? What wrong have we done? What sin have we done against the Lord our God?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you tell them, ‘It is because your fathers before you have turned away from Me,’ says the Lord. ‘They have followed other gods and served them and worshiped them. But they have left Me and have not kept My Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you have sinned even more than your fathers before you. For see, each one of you is following the strong-will of his own sinful heart instead of listening to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will throw you out of this land into a land which you and your fathers have not known. There you will serve other gods day and night, for I will show you no favor.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So the days are coming,” says the Lord, “when it will no longer be said, ‘As the Lord lives, Who brought up the sons of Israel out of the land of Egypt.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it will be said, ‘As the Lord lives, Who brought the sons of Israel from the land of the north and from all the countries where He had sent them.’ For I will return them to their own land which I gave to their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, I am going to send for many fishermen,” says the Lord, “and they will fish for them. After this I will send for many men who hunt. And they will hunt them from every mountain and every hill, and out of the holes in the rocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I see all their ways. They are not hidden from My face, and their sin is not hidden from My eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will pay them back twice as much for their wrong-doing and their sin, because they have made My land unclean. They have filled My land with the bodies of their hated false gods and with sinful things offered to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord, my strength and my strong-place, my safe place in the day of trouble, nations will come to You from the ends of the earth and say, “Our fathers have received nothing but lies, only things that have no worth and do not help them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can man make his own gods? What man makes is not gods!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So I am going to make them know. This time I will make them know My power and My strength. And they will know that My name is the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sin of Judah is written down with pen of iron and with a sharp diamond. It is written on their hearts and on the horns of their altars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even their children remember their altars and their wooden female goddesses of Asherah by green trees and on the high hills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O My mountain in the country, I will give your money and all your riches to those who fight against you. I will give your high places as the price of your sin through all your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you yourself will let your land go that I gave you. I will make you serve those who hate you in a land which you do not know. For you have made My an-ger start a fire which will burn forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator
