verses.text: The Lord says, “Cursed is the man who trusts in man, who trusts in the flesh for his strength, and whose heart turns away from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he will be like a bush in the desert and will not see when good comes. He will live in dry wastes in the desert, in a land of salt where no other people live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Good will come to the man who trusts in the Lord, and whose hope is in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be like a tree planted by the water, that sends out its roots by the river. It will not be afraid when the heat comes but its leaves will be green. It will not be troubled in a dry year, or stop giving fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The heart is fooled more than anything else, and is very sinful. Who can know how bad it is?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I the Lord look into the heart, and test the mind. I give to each man what he should have because of his ways and because of the fruit that comes from his works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a bird that sits on eggs which it has not laid, so is he who gets rich by doing wrong. When his life is half over, they will leave him, and in the end he will be a fool.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A beautiful throne on high from the beginning is our holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord, the hope of Israel, all who leave You will be put to shame. Those who turn away from You will be written in the earth, because they have left the Lord, the well of living water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heal me, O Lord, and I will be healed. Save me and I will be saved. For You are my praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They say to me, “Where is the Word of the Lord? Let it come now!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for me, I have not run away from being a shepherd who follows You. And I have not been hoping for the day of trouble. You know what I said was spoken in front of You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not make me afraid of You. You are my safe place in the day of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let those who make it hard for me be put to shame, but do not let me be put to shame. Let them be afraid, but do not let me be afraid. Bring on them a day of trouble, and destroy them with twice as much!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me, “Go and stand in the people’s gate, through which the kings of Judah come in and go out, and also in all the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And say to them, ‘Listen to the Word of the Lord, kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all people of Jerusalem who come in through these gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord says, “Be careful for your lives. Do not carry any load on the Day of Rest or bring anything in through the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not bring a load out of your houses on the Day of Rest or do any work. But keep the Day of Rest holy, as I told your fathers before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they did not listen or hear, but made their necks hard and would not change their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen to Me,” says the Lord, “and bring no load through the city gates on the Day of Rest. Keep the Day of Rest holy by doing no work on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then kings and their sons will come through the city gates who will sit on the throne of David. They will come in war-wagons and on horses, with the men of Judah and the people of Jerusalem. And people will live in this city forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People will come in from the cities of Judah and from the places around Jerusalem. They will come from the land of Benjamin, from the valleys, from the hill country, and from the Negev. They will bring burnt gifts, animals to kill on the altar in worship, grain gifts, special perfume, and gifts of thanks to the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do not listen to Me, to keep the Day of Rest holy by not carrying a load when coming through the gates of Jerusalem on the Day of Rest, then I will start a fire in its gates. And it will burn up the beautiful houses of the kings of Jerusalem and will not be stopped.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go down to the pot-maker’s house, and there I will let you hear My words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I went down to the pot-maker’s house, and saw him making one on the wheel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the pot he was making of clay did not come out like he wanted it. So the pot-maker used the clay to make another pot that pleased him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Word of the Lord came to me saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O people of Israel, can I not do with you as this potmaker has done?” says the Lord. “Like the clay in the pot-maker’s hand, so are you in My hand, O people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If at any time I speak about a nation, to pull up, and to break down and to destroy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if that nation I spoke against turns from its sin, then I will change My mind about the trouble I planned to bring upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If at another time I speak about a nation, that I will build and plant it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if it does what is sinful in My eyes by not obeying My voice, then I will change My mind about the good I had promised to bring to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now speak to the men of Judah and the people of Jerusalem. Tell them, ‘The Lord says, “See, I am making trouble for you and making a plan against you. So each of you turn from your sinful way. Change your ways and your works.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they will say, ‘There is no hope! For we are going to follow our own plans. Each of us will act in the strong-will of his sinful heart.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So the Lord says, ‘Ask now among the nations: Who has heard such things? Pure Israel has done a very sinful thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does the snow of Lebanon ever leave its rocky mountains? Does the cold flowing water of other lands ever dry up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But My people have forgotten Me. They burn special perfume to false gods of no worth. They have fallen in their ways, from the old paths, and have gone on side roads, not on the straight road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They make their land a waste, a thing that is spoken against forever. Everyone who passes by it will be surprised and shake his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send them out everywhere like an east wind in front of those who hate them. I will show them My back and not My face in the day of their trouble.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Come and let us make plans against Jeremiah. For the Law is not going to be lost to the religious leader, or wise words to the wise man, or the Word of God to the man of God! Come and let us hurt him with our tongue, and let us not listen to any of his words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Think of me, O Lord, and listen to what those who hate me are saying!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should bad be given in return for good? Yet they have dug a deep hole for me. Remember how I stood before You to speak good for them, to turn Your anger away from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So give their children over to hunger. Give them up to the power of the sword. Let their wives lose their children and husbands. Let their men be put to death. And let their young men be killed by the sword in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May a cry be heard from their houses when You bring an army upon them by surprise. For they have dug a deep hole to take me, and have hidden traps for my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet You, O Lord, know all their plans to kill me. Do not forgive their wrong-doing or cover their sin from Your eyes. Let them be taken down before You. Punish them in the time of Your anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord says, “Go and buy a pot-maker’s clay jar, and take some of the leaders of the people and some of the older religious leaders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then go out to the valley of BenHinnom, by the Potsherd Gate, and there say the words that I will tell you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say, ‘Hear the Word of the Lord, O kings of Judah and people of Jerusalem. The Lord of All, the God of Israel, says, “See, I am about to bring much trouble to this place. The ears of everyone that hears of it will hurt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people have left Me and have made this a strange place. They have burned special perfume in it to other gods that they and their fathers and the kings of Judah had never known. They have filled this place with the blood of those who were not guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have built the high places of the false god Baal to burn their sons in the fire as burnt gifts to Baal. This is a thing which I never told them to do or spoke of. It did not even come to My mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So see, the days are coming,” says the Lord, “when this place will no longer be called Topheth or the valley of BenHinnom. Instead it will be called the Valley of Killing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make the plans of Judah and Jerusalem come to nothing in this place. I will cause them to fall by the sword in front of those who hate them and by the hand of those who want to kill them. And I will feed their dead bodies to the birds of the sky and the wild animals of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make this city a waste place, and people will make sounds of hate. Everyone who passes by it will be surprised and make strange noises because of all its troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make them eat the flesh of their sons and daughters. And they will eat each other’s flesh when the armies shut them in, and when those who want to kill them bring much trouble to them.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you are to break the jar in front of the men who go with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And say to them, ‘The Lord of All says, “In this way I will break these people and this city, even as one breaks a pot-maker’s jar, which cannot be put back together. Men will bury the dead in Topheth until there is no place left to bury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what I will do to this place and its people,” says the Lord. “I will make this city like Topheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The houses of Jerusalem and the houses of the kings of Judah will be made unclean like Topheth. This will be because of all the houses on whose roofs they burned special perfume to all the false gods of the heavens and poured out drink gifts to other gods.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah came from Topheth, where the Lord had sent him to tell what would happen. And he stood in the open space of the Lord’s house and said to all the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord of All, the God of Israel, says, ‘See, I am about to bring to this city and to all its towns all the trouble that I have spoken about, because they have made their necks hard and would not listen to My Words.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Pashhur the religious leader, the son of Immer, was the head leader in the house of the Lord. When he heard Jeremiah saying these things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pashhur had Jeremiah the man of God beaten. Then he put him in chains at the upper Benjamin Gate by the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day, when Pashhur set Jeremiah free from the chains, Jeremiah said to him, “The Lord does not call you Pashhur, but Fear Everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord says, ‘See, I am going to make you a fear to yourself and to all your friends. They will fall by the sword of those who hate them while you look on. I will give all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon. And he will carry them away in chains to Babylon and will kill them with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give over all the riches of this city, all that its people have worked for, and all its things of much worth. Even all the riches of the kings of Judah I will give to those who hate them. They will take their things, and take hold of them, and carry them to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Pashhur, and all who live in your house will be taken away in chains. You will go to Babylon, and there you will die, and there you will be buried, you and all your friends to whom you have told lies.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord, You have lied to me and I was fooled. You are stronger than I, and have had power over me. I have been laughed at all day. Everyone makes fun of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whenever I speak, I cry out. I tell of fighters and destroyers. For the Word of the Lord has become a shame and a cause of laughing at me all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I say, “I will not remember Him or speak any more in His name,” then in my heart it is like a burning fire shut up in my bones. I am tired of holding it in, and I cannot do that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have heard many speaking in secret, saying, “Fear and trouble is on every side! Speak against him! Yes, let us speak against him!” All my trusted friends, watching for my fall, say, “It may be that he will be fooled. Then we can get power over him and punish him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord is with me like a powerful one who causes fear. So those who make it hard for me will fall and not have power over me. They will be put to much shame, because their plans have not gone well. Their shame will last forever and will not be forgotten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord of All, You test those who are right and good. You see the mind and the heart. Let me see You punish them, for I have given my cause to You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sing to the Lord! Praise the Lord! For He has taken the soul of the one in need from the hand of the sinful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cursed is the day when I was born! Let the day not be honored when my mother gave birth to me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cursed be the man who brought the news to my father, saying, “A baby boy has been born to you!” and made him very happy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let that man be like the cities which the Lord destroyed without pity. Let him hear a cry in the morning and a call of danger at noon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he did not kill me before I was born, so that my mother’s body would have been my grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why was I ever born to see trouble and sorrow, and spend my days in shame?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur the son of Malchijah, and Zephaniah the religious leader, the son of Maaseiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Will you speak to the Lord about us? For King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon is making war against us. It may be that the Lord will do something for us like He did in times past, and make him leave us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to them, “Say this to Zedekiah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The Lord God of Israel says, “See, I will turn against you the objects of war you are using to fight with against the king of Babylon and the Babylonians who are gathered outside the wall to shut you in. And I will bring them into the center of this city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I Myself will fight against you with My hand out and with a strong arm, in much anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will kill both man and animal in this city. They will die of a bad disease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this,” says the Lord, “I will give over Zedekiah king of Judah, his servants, and the people who were not killed in this city by the disease, the sword, and hunger. I will give them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of those who hate them, and into the hand of those who want to kill them. And he will kill them with the sword. He will not let them live or have pity for them.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Also tell the people, ‘The Lord says, “See, I set before you the way of life and the way of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who lives in this city will die by the sword and by hunger and by disease. But he who goes out and gives himself up to the Babylonians whose armies shut you in will live, he will at least have his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have set My face against this city for trouble and not for good,” says the Lord. “It will be given to the king of Babylon, and he will burn it with fire.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then say to those of the house of the king of Judah, ‘Hear the Word of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O house of David, the Lord says, “Do what is right every morning. Take the person who has been robbed away from the one who has made it hard for him. So My anger will not go out like fire and burn with no one to put it out, because of the sinful things you have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, I am against you, O you who live in the valley, O rock of the plain,” says the Lord, “you who say, ‘Who will come down against us? Or who will come into our houses?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will punish you for what has come of what you have done,” says the Lord. “I will start a fire among your trees, and it will destroy all that is around it.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord says, “Go down to the house of the king of Judah, and speak this word there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say, ‘Hear the Word of the Lord, O king of Judah, who sits on David’s throne, you and your servants and your people who come through these gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord says, “Do what is right and fair and good, and take the one who has been robbed away from the power of the one who has made it hard for him. Do not hurt or do wrong to the stranger, the one whose parents have died, or the woman whose husband has died. And do not kill those who are not guilty in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you will obey this word, then kings will come through the gates of this house and sit on the throne of David. They will be in war-wagons and on horses, together with their servants and their people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you will not obey these words, I promise by Myself,” says the Lord, “that this house will be destroyed.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord says about the house of the king of Judah: “You are like Gilead to Me, or like the top of Lebanon. Yet I will be sure to make you like a desert, like cities without people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send destroyers against you, each with his things for fighting. And they will cut down your best cedar trees and throw them on the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many nations will pass by this city, and they will say to one another, ‘Why has the Lord done such a thing to this great city?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will answer, ‘Because they did not keep the agreement of the Lord their God. They worshiped other gods and served them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not cry for the one who is dead or have sorrow for him. But cry all the time for the one who goes away, for he will never return or see the land of his birth again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord says about Shallum the son of Josiah, king of Judah, who ruled in the place of Josiah his father, and who left this place: “He will never return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will die in the place where they took him, and he will not see this land again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It is bad for him who builds his house by wrong-doing, and his upper rooms by not being fair, who has his neighbor serve him for nothing and does not pay him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who says, ‘I will build myself a big house with large upper rooms. I will cut out its windows, cover it with cedar and color it bright red.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you become a king by trying to build better houses of cedar? Did not your father eat and drink? He did what was right and fair and good, so all went well with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke strong words in the cause of the poor and those in need, and so all went well. Is not that what it means to know Me?” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But your eyes and heart are set only on what you can get by wrong-doing, and on killing those who are not guilty, and on making it hard for people and on hurting others.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord says about Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, “They will not cry in sorrow for him, saying, ‘It is bad, my brother!’ or, ‘It is bad, my sister!’ They will not cry in sorrow for him, saying, ‘O lord!’ or, ‘O, how great he was!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be buried like they bury a donkey, pulled away and thrown out on the other side of the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go up to Lebanon and cry out. And let your voice be heard in Bashan. Cry out from Abarim also. For all your lovers have been destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I spoke to you when things were going well for you, but you said, ‘I will not listen!’ This has been your way since you were young. You have not obeyed My voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wind will take away all your shepherds, and your lovers will be taken away in chains. Then you will be ashamed and troubled because of all your sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O you people of Lebanon, who make your nest among the cedars, how you will cry inside yourselves when pain comes upon you! It will be pain like a woman giving birth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As I live,” says the Lord, “even if Coniah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, were a marking ring on My right hand, I would still pull you off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give you over to those who want to kill you, to those whom you fear. I will give you to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and to the Babylonians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will throw you and your mother who gave birth to you into another country where you were not born, and there you will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will want to return to this land again but you will not return.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is this man Coniah a hated, broken jar? Is he a pot that no one cares for? Why have he and his children been thrown out into a land that they had not known?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O land, land, land, hear the Word of the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord says, “Write this man down as one who has no children, a man who will not do well in his days. For none of his children or children’s children will do well sitting on the throne of David or ruling again in Judah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It is bad for the shepherds who are destroying and dividing the sheep of My field!” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord God of Israel says this about the shepherds who are caring for My people, “You have made My flock go everywhere and have driven them away, and have not cared for them. See, I am about to punish you for your sinful things you have done,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then I Myself will gather those who are left of My flock out of all the countries where I have driven them, and will bring them back to their field. And they will have many children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will have shepherds over them who will care for them. And they will not be afraid any longer, or filled with fear, and none of them will be missing,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, the days are coming,” says the Lord, “when I will raise up for David a right and good Branch. He will rule as king and be wise and do what is right and fair and good in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In His days Judah will be saved, and Israel will be safe. And this is the name He will be called by: ‘The Lord Who makes us right and good.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So see, the days are coming,” says the Lord, “when they will no longer say, ‘As the Lord lives, Who brought the sons of Israel up from the land of Egypt.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they will say, ‘As the Lord lives, Who brought up and led the children of the people of Israel back from the north country and from all the countries where He had driven them.’ Then they will live in their own land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the men who speak for God, my heart is broken within me. All my bones shake. I have become like a drunk man, like a man who has had too much wine, because of the Lord and because of His holy words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the land is full of people who are not faithful. Because of the bad things that have come upon it, the land is filled with sorrow, and the fields of the desert have dried up. Their way is sinful, and they use their power in a wrong way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For both the men of God and the religious leaders are sinful. I have found their sin even in My house,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So their way will be a danger to them. They will be driven away into the darkness and fall down in it. For I will bring much trouble upon them in the year of their punishment,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In Samaria I have seen a very bad thing among the men of Samaria who tell what is going to happen in the future. They speak for the false god Baal, and have led My people into sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Jerusalem I have seen a very sinful thing among the men of Jerusalem who tell what is going to happen in the future. They do sex sins and tell lies, and give help to those who do sinful things, so that no one turns from his sin. All of them have become like Sodom to Me. The people of Jerusalem have become like Gomorrah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord of All says about the men who tell what is going to happen in the future, “See, I will make them eat bitter food and drink water with poison. For from these men of Jerusalem sin has gone out into all the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord of All says, “Do not listen to the words of those who are telling you what will happen in the future. They are filling you with empty hopes. They tell of dreams from their own thoughts, not from the mouth of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They keep saying to those who hate Me, ‘The Lord has said, “You will have peace.”’ To every one who walks in the strong-will of his own heart, they say, ‘Trouble will not come to you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But who among them has listened to the Lord, that he should see and hear His Word? Who has given thought to His Word and listened?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, the strong wind storm of the Lord has gone out in anger. It will come down upon the head of the sinful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The anger of the Lord will not turn back until He has done all that He has planned in His heart. In the last days you will understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I did not send these men who say they speak for God, yet they ran to tell their news. I did not speak to them, yet they spoke in My name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they had listened to Me, then they would have made My words known to My people. And they would have turned them back from their sinful way and from the sinful things they did.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Am I a God Who is near,” says the Lord, “and not a God Who is far away?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can a man hide himself in secret places so that I cannot see him?” says the Lord. “Do I not fill heaven and earth?” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have heard what the men say who speak false words in My name. They say, ‘I had a dream, I had a dream!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long will there be lies in the hearts of those who speak false words in My name, who speak the lies of their own heart?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They plan to make My people forget My name by their dreams which they tell one another, just as their fathers forgot My name because of Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who has a dream may tell about his dream, but let him who has My Word speak My Word in truth. How can straw be compared with grain?” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Is not My Word like fire,” says the Lord, “and like iron that breaks a rock in pieces?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I am against those who tell what is going to happen in the future,” says the Lord, “who steal My words from each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I am against these men,” says the Lord, “who use their tongues and say, ‘This is what the Lord says.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am against those who have told false dreams,” says the Lord, “and have led My people the wrong way by their lies and foolish words of pride. I did not send them or tell them what to say, so they do not help these people at all,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When these people, or the one who speaks in My name, or a religious leader asks you, ‘What heavy load has the Lord placed on us?’ then you say to them, ‘You are the heavy load. And I will throw you off, says the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the man who speaks in My name, or the religious leader, or anyone of the people, who say, ‘The heavy load of the Lord,’ I will punish that man and those of his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of you say to his neighbor and to his brother, ‘What has the Lord answered?’ or, ‘What has the Lord said?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you must not say, ‘The heavy load of the Lord,’ any more. For every man’s own word will be the weight upon himself. And you have made sinful the words of the living God, the Lord of All, our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you should say to the man who speaks in My name: ‘What answer has the Lord given you?’ and, ‘What has the Lord said?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you say, ‘The heavy load of the Lord,’ then the Lord says, ‘You have said, “The heavy load of the Lord,” when I told you not to say it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will pick you up and throw you away from Me, together with the city which I gave to you and your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will put you to shame forever. You will always be ashamed, and it will not be forgotten.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon took away Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and the leaders of Judah, together with the able workmen from Jerusalem, and brought them to Babylon, the Lord showed me two baskets of figs set in front of the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One basket had very good figs, like figs just ready to eat. And the other basket had very bad figs, so bad that they could not be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “What do you see, Jeremiah?” And I said, “Figs, the good figs very good, and the bad figs very bad, so bad that they cannot be eaten.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord God of Israel says: ‘Like these good figs, so will I think of the people of Judah as being good, whom I have sent away from this place into the land of the Babylonians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will keep My eyes on them for their good, and I will return them to this land. I will build them up and not tear them down. I will plant them and not pull them up by the roots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will give them a heart to know Me, for I am the Lord. They will be My people and I will be their God, for they will return to Me with their whole heart.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the Lord says, ‘Like the bad figs which are so bad they cannot be eaten, so I will give up Zedekiah king of Judah and his captains. And I will give up those left of Jerusalem who stay in this land, and those who live in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make them a cause of fear and trouble for all the nations of the earth. They will be a shame and a curse and spoken against in all the places where I will make them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will send the sword and hunger and disease upon them until they are destroyed from the land which I gave to them and their fathers.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that came to Jeremiah about all the people of Judah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah. (That was the first year of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah the man of God spoke this word to all the people of Judah and Jerusalem, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These twenty-three years, from the thirteenth year of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, until this day, the Word of the Lord has come to me. And I have spoken to you again and again, but you have not listened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord has sent to you all his servants who have spoken for Him again and again, but you have not listened or turned your ear to hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have said, ‘Every one of you turn now from your sinful way and the sinful things you do, and live on the land which the Lord has given to you and your fathers forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not go after other gods to serve and worship them. Do not make Me angry with the work you do, and I will not hurt you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you have not listened to Me,” says the Lord. “You have made Me angry with the work of your hands to your own hurt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So the Lord of All says, ‘Because you have not obeyed My words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send for all the families of the north. And I will send for Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, My servant, and will bring them against this land, against its people, and against all these nations around you. I will make a complete end of them. I will destroy them all and make them an object of fear and hate, and a waste place forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also take from them the voice of joy, the voice of happiness, the voice of the man to be married and the voice of the bride. I will take from them the sound of the grinding stones and the light of the lamp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This whole land will be a waste and a cause of fear. And these nations will serve the king of Babylon for seventy years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Then when seventy years have past, I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation, and the land of the Babylonians, for their sin,’ says the Lord. ‘And I will make that land a waste forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring upon that land all My words which I have spoken against it, all that is written in this book, which Jeremiah has spoken against all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They themselves will be made to serve many nations and great kings. I will pay them for what they have done, and for the work of their hands.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord, the God of Israel, says to me, “Take this cup of the wine of anger from My hand. And make all the nations to whom I send you drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will drink and have trouble walking and become crazy because of the sword that I will send among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I took the cup from the Lord’s hand, and made all the nations to whom the Lord sent me drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was sent to Jerusalem and to the cities of Judah, to its kings and its leaders, to make them a waste, an object of fear and hate, and a curse, as it is this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was sent to Pharaoh king of Egypt, his servants, his sons, and to all his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was sent to all the people from different countries, all the kings of the land of Uz, and to all the kings of the land of the Philistines (Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and those left of Ashdod).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was sent to Edom, Moab, the sons of Ammon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to all the kings of Tyre, all the kings of Sidon, and to the kings of the lands across the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was sent to Dedan, Tema, Buz, to all who are far away in their lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to the kings of Arabia, and to all the kings of the different people who live in the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was sent to all the kings of Zimri, all the kings of Elam, all the kings of Media,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to all the kings of the north, near and far, one after another. I was sent to all the nations on the earth. And after them the king of Sheshach will drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you will say to them, ‘The Lord of All, the God of Israel, says, “Drink, be drunk, throw up, fall, and get up no more, because of the sword which I will send among you.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if they will not take the cup from your hand to drink, then say to them, ‘The Lord of All says, “You must drink!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I am beginning to make trouble in this city which is called by My name. And will you not be punished? You will not be free from punishment, for I am bringing a sword against all the people of the earth,” says the Lord of All.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So you should speak all these words against them. Tell them, ‘The Lord will sound from on high. His voice will be heard from His holy place. He will call out in a loud voice against his flock. He will call out like those who crush the grapes, against all the people of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The noise will go to the ends of the earth, because the Lord has something against the nations. He is deciding what should be done with all flesh. As for the sinful, He has given them to the sword,’” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord of All says, “See, sinful ways are spreading from nation to nation. A powerful storm is moving from the farthest parts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those killed by the Lord on that day will be from one end of the earth to the other. No one will cry for them or gather up the bodies and bury them. They will be like animal waste on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cry in a loud voice, you shepherds. And roll in ashes, you leaders of the flock. For the days for you to be killed and sent everywhere have come, and you will fall and be broken like a fine pot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The shepherds will have no place to run. And the leaders of the flock will have no place to get away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen to the cry of the shepherds and the loud cry of the leaders of the flock! For the Lord is destroying their field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fields of peace are laid waste because of the burning anger of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has left His hiding place like a lion. For their land has become a cause of much fear because of the sword of the one who makes it hard for them, and because of the Lord’s burning anger.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the beginning of the rule of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came from the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord says: ‘Stand in the open space of the Lord’s house, and speak to all the cities of Judah who have come to worship in the Lord’s house. Tell them all the words that I have told you to say to them. Do not leave out one word!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It may be they will listen and everyone will turn from his sinful way. Then I may change My mind about the trouble I plan to put on them because of the sinful things they have done.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And tell them, ‘This is what the Lord says: “If you will not listen to Me and follow My Law which I have set before you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if you do not listen to the words of My servants who speak for Me, whom I have been sending to you again and again, but you have not listened,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will make this House of God like Shiloh. And I will make this city a curse to all the nations of the earth.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious leaders and the men of God and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jeremiah had finished speaking all that the Lord had told him to speak to all the people, the religious leaders and men of God and all the people took hold of him, saying, “You must die!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why have you spoken in the name of the Lord saying, ‘This house will be like Shiloh, and this city will be laid waste with no one living in it’?” And all the people gathered around Jeremiah in the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the leaders of Judah heard these things, they came up from the king’s house to the house of the Lord and sat beside the New Gate of the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the religious leaders and men of God said to the leaders and to all the people, “This man must die! For he has spoken against this city, as you have heard with your own ears.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to all the leaders and to all the people, “The Lord sent me to speak against this house and against this city all the words that you have heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now change your ways and your works, and obey the voice of the Lord your God. Then the Lord will change His mind about the trouble He has said would come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for me, see, I am in your hands. Do with me what is good and right in your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only know for sure that if you put me to death, you will bring the sin of killing a man who is not guilty on yourselves, on this city, and on its people. For it is true that the Lord has sent me to you to speak all these words for you to hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the leaders and all the people said to the religious leaders and men of God, “No, this man should not be put to death! For he has spoken to us in the name of the Lord our God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of the leaders of the land stood up and said to all the people who had gathered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Micah of Moresheth spoke in God’s name in the days of King Hezekiah of Judah. He said to all the people of Judah, ‘This is what the Lord of All has said: Zion will be plowed as a field, and Jerusalem will be destroyed. And trees will cover the mountain where the Lord’s house is.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did King Hezekiah of Judah and all the people of Judah put him to death? Did he not fear the Lord and pray for the Lord’s favor? And the Lord changed His mind about the trouble He had said would come to them. But we are about to bring a very bad thing on ourselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was another man who spoke in the name of the Lord. He was Uriah the son of Shemaiah from Kiriath-jearim. He spoke against this city and against this land in words like those of Jeremiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When King Jehoiakim and all his powerful men and all his leaders heard his words, the king wanted to put Uriah to death. But Uriah heard about it, and he was afraid and ran away to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King Jehoiakim sent Elnathan the son of Achbor and certain men with him to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took Uriah from Egypt and brought him to King Jehoiakim, who killed him with a sword. Then he threw his dead body where most people are buried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Ahikam the son of Shaphan helped Jeremiah, so that he was not given over to the people to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the beginning of the rule of Zedekiah the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me, “Make ropes and a cross-bar for carrying a load, and put them on your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then send word to the king of Edom, to the king of Moab, to the king of the sons of Ammon, to the king of Tyre, and to the king of Sidon. Send them with the men who bring news to Jerusalem to King Zedekiah of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell them to go to their leaders, saying, ‘This is what the Lord of All, the God of Israel, says, and this is what you should say to your leaders:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have made the earth, and the men and the animals that are on it by My great power and by My long arm. And I will give it to the one who is right in My eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I have given all these lands to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, My servant. And I have given him the wild animals of the field to serve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the nations will serve him and his son and his grandson, until the time for his land comes. Then many nations and great kings will make him their servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if any nation will not serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and will not put its neck under the load of the king of Babylon, I will punish that nation with the sword, hunger, and disease,” says the Lord, “until I have destroyed it by his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So do not listen to your men who tell of their special dreams, your men who tell what is going to happen in the future, or your wonder workers who use their secret ways. They say to you, ‘You must not serve the king of Babylon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they are lying to you, and will cause you to be taken far from your land. I will drive you out, and you will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the nation that brings its neck under the cross-bar of the king of Babylon and serves him, I will let stay on its own land,” says the Lord. “And its people will take care of the fields and live there.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I spoke to King Zedekiah of Judah in the same way, saying, “Bring your necks under the cross-bar of the king of Babylon. Serve him and his people, and live!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why will you and your people die by the sword, hunger, and disease, as the Lord has said would happen to that nation which will not serve the king of Babylon?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not listen to the men who tell of their dreams and say to you, ‘You will not serve the king of Babylon.’ For they are telling you a lie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not sent them,” says the Lord. “They speak false words in My name, so that I may drive you out, and that you may die, both you and the men who tell these things to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said to the religious leaders and to all these people, “The Lord says: Do not listen to the men who speak in God’s name saying, ‘See, the objects of the Lord’s house will soon be returned from Babylon,’ for they are telling you a lie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not listen to them. Serve the king of Babylon and live! Why should this city be destroyed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they are true men of God, and if the Word of the Lord is with them, let them now pray to the Lord of All. Let them ask that the objects which are left in the house of the Lord, in the house of the king of Judah, and in Jerusalem, may not go to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord of All says about the pillars, the brass pool, the stands, and the rest of the objects that are left in this city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon did not take these things from Jerusalem to Babylon when he took Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and all the leaders of Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So this is what the Lord of All, the God of Israel, says about the objects that are left in the house of the Lord, and in the house of the king of Judah, and in Jerusalem. He says,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘They will be carried to Babylon, and they will be there until the day I visit them,’ says the Lord. ‘Then I will bring them back to this place.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that same year, in the beginning of the rule of King Zedekiah of Judah, in the fifth month of the fourth year, Hananiah the son of Azzur, the man from Gibeon who told what would happen in the future, spoke to me in the house of the Lord. He said to me in front of the religious leaders and all the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord of All, the God of Israel, says: ‘I have broken the crossbar across the shoulders of the king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Within two years I will bring back to this place all the objects of the Lord’s house, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took away from here and carried to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also bring back to this place Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and all the people of Judah who were taken to Babylon,’ says the Lord. ‘For I will break the cross-bar of the king of Babylon.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah, the man of God, spoke to Hananiah, the man who told what would happen, in front of the religious leaders and all the people who were standing in the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jeremiah, the man who spoke for God, said, “Let it be so! May the Lord do so. May the Lord make the words you have spoken come true, and bring back to this place from Babylon the objects of the Lord’s house and all the people of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet listen now to what I am about to say in your hearing and in the hearing of all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men who spoke for God before us from long ago spoke of war and trouble and disease coming to many lands and great nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the man who told that peace would come, when his word comes to pass, then that man will be known as the one that the Lord has sent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hananiah, the man who told what would happen, took the cross-bar from the neck of Jeremiah the man of God and broke it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hananiah said in front of all the people, “The Lord says, ‘In this way I will break the cross-bar of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon from the neck of all the nations within two years.’” Then Jeremiah the man of God went his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some time after Hananiah had broken the cross-bar from off the neck of Jeremiah, the Word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go and tell Hananiah, ‘The Lord says, “You have broken the cross-bars of wood, but you have made bars of iron in their place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord of All, the God of Israel, says, “I have put the cross-bar of iron on the neck of all these nations, that they may serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon. And they will serve him. I have given him the animals of the field also.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah who spoke for God said to Hananiah who told what would happen, “Listen, Hananiah, the Lord has not sent you. And you have made these people trust in a lie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord says, ‘See, I am about to take you from the earth. This year you are going to die, because you have spoken against the right and power of the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Hananiah, who had said these things in God’s name, died in the seventh month of the same year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the words of the letter which Jeremiah the man of God sent from Jerusalem to the leaders, the religious leaders, the men of God, and all the people whom Nebuchadnezzar had taken away from Jerusalem to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (This was after King Jeconiah and the queen mother, the king’s servants, the rulers of Judah and Jerusalem, and the able workmen had left Jerusalem.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The letter was sent with Elasah the son of Shaphan, and Gemariah the son of Hilkiah, whom King Zedekiah of Judah sent to King Nebuchadnezzar in Babylon. It said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord of All, the God of Israel, says to all of His people who have been sent from Jerusalem to Babylon:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Build houses and live in them. Plant gardens and eat their fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take wives and become the fathers of sons and daughters. And take wives for your sons and give your daughters in marriage, that they may give birth to sons and daughters. Become many there, and do not let your number become less.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Work for the well-being of the city where I have sent you to and pray to the Lord for this. For if it is well with the city you live in, it will be well with you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord of All, the God of Israel, says, ‘Do not let the people among you who tell what is going to happen in the future and those who use their secret ways fool you. Do not listen to their dreams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they speak false words to you in My name. I have not sent them,’ says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the Lord says, ‘When seventy years are completed for Babylon, I will visit you and keep My promise to you. I will bring you back to this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know the plans I have for you,’ says the Lord, ‘plans for well-being and not for trouble, to give you a future and a hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will call upon Me and come and pray to Me, and I will listen to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will look for Me and find Me, when you look for Me with all your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will be found by you,’ says the Lord. ‘And I will bring you back and gather you from all the nations and all the places where I have made you go,’ says the Lord. ‘I will bring you back to the place from where I sent you away.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You have said that the Lord has given men who speak for Him in Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says about the king who sits on the throne of David, and about all the people who live in this city, your brothers who were not taken with you to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord of All says, ‘I am sending the sword, hunger, and disease upon them. I will make them like bad figs which are so bad they cannot be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will go after them with the sword, hunger, and disease, and will make them a cause of trouble to all the nations of the earth. They will be a curse, an object of much shame and hate among all the nations where I have made them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is because they have not listened to My words,’ says the Lord, ‘which I sent to them again and again by My servants who spoke for Me. And you did not listen,’ says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So hear the Word of the Lord, all you people who have been sent away from Jerusalem to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord of All, the God of Israel, says about Ahab the son of Kolaiah and about Zedekiah the son of Maaseiah, who are speaking false words to you in My name: ‘See, I will give them over to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon. And he will kill them in front of your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of them a curse will be used by all the people who are from Judah but are in Babylon: “May the Lord make you like Zedekiah and like Ahab, whom the king of Babylon burned in the fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is because they have done what is foolish in Israel. They have done sex sins with their neighbors’ wives. And they have spoken false words in My name, which I did not tell them to speak. I am He Who knows, and I see what they have done,’ says the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And say to Shemaiah the Nehelamite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord of All, the God of Israel, says: ‘You have sent letters in your own name to all the people in Jerusalem and to Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the religious leader, and to all the religious leaders. You said to Zephaniah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord has made you the religious leader over the house of the Lord instead of Jehoiada. You are to take every crazy man who says he speaks in God’s name and put him in chains with iron around his neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So why have you not spoken sharp words to Jeremiah of Anathoth who is speaking to you in God’s name?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he has sent word to us in Babylon, saying, ‘You will be held there for a long time. So build houses and live in them. And plant gardens and eat their fruit.’”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zephaniah the religious leader read this letter to Jeremiah the man of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Send word to all My people held in Babylon, saying, ‘This is what the Lord says about Shemaiah the Nehelamite: Shemaiah has spoken to you in My name, but I did not send him. He has made you trust in a lie.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord says, ‘I am about to punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite and his children after him. He will not have anyone living among these people. And he will not see the good that I am about to do to My people,’ says the Lord, ‘because he has spoken against Me.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: ‘Write in a book all the words which I have spoken to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the days are coming,’ says the Lord, ‘when I will bring back My people Israel and Judah from where they are held.’ The Lord says, ‘I will bring them back to the land that I gave to their fathers before them, and it will be theirs.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the words which the Lord spoke about Israel and Judah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord says, ‘I have heard cries of much trouble, of being afraid, and there is no peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ask now and see, can a man give birth to a child? Why do I see every man with his hands on his body like a woman giving birth? Why have all faces turned white?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That day will be very bad! There is none like it. It is the time of Jacob’s trouble, but he will be saved out of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day,’ says the Lord of All, ‘I will break the cross-bar off from their neck, and will tear off their chains. Strangers will no longer make them their servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they will serve the Lord their God and David their king, whom I will raise up for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So do not be afraid, O Jacob My servant,’ says the Lord, ‘and do not be troubled, O Israel, for see, from far away I will save you and your children from the land where they are being held. Jacob will return and have quiet rest, and no one will make him afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am with you to save you,’ says the Lord. ‘I will make a complete end of all the nations where I have sent you. I will not make a complete end of you, but I will give you the right punishment. I will not let you go without being punished.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the Lord says, ‘Your hurt cannot be healed. Your hurt is very bad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no one to ask for you in your cause, no help for your hurt, no healing for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All your lovers have forgotten you. They do not care about you. For I have hurt you as if you were hurt by one who hates you. You have been punished without pity, because you have much guilt. You have done many sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you cry out because of your hurt? Your pain cannot be healed. Because you have much guilt and have done many sins, I have done these things to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all who destroy you will be destroyed. Every one of those who hate you will be taken away against their will. Those who rob you will be robbed, and all who hurt you will be hurt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will heal you. I will heal you where you have been hurt,’ says the Lord, ‘because they have said that you are not wanted. They have said, “It is Zion. No one cares for her.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord says, ‘I will bring the tents of Jacob back from Babylon, and will have pity on his houses. The city will be built up again on its broken walls. And the king’s house will stand where it used to be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people who live there will give much thanks and happy voices will be heard. And I will add to their numbers. They will not be made less. I will honor them, and they will be important.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their children will be as they were before. They will be a strong people before Me. And I will punish all those who make it hard for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their leader will be one of them. Their ruler will come from among them. I will bring him near, and he will come close to Me. For who would have the strength of heart to come near Me on his own?’ says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘And you will be My people, and I will be your God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See the storm of the Lord! Anger has gone out, a very bad storm. It will break upon the heads of the sinful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The burning anger of the Lord will not turn back until He has done what He has planned in His heart to do. In days to come you will understand this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time,” says the Lord, “I will be the God of all the families of Israel, and they will be My people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord says, “The people who were not killed by the sword found loving-favor in the desert, when Israel looked for rest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord came to us from far away, saying, “I have loved you with a love that lasts forever. So I have helped you come to Me with loving-kindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again I will build you, and you will be built, O pure Israel! Again you will take up your brass noise-makers and go to the dances of the happy people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again you will plant grape-fields on the hills of Samaria. The planters will plant and find joy in the fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there will be a day when watchmen on the hills of Ephraim will call out, ‘Get up, and let us go up to Zion, to the Lord our God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord says, “Sing loud with joy for Jacob, and call out among the heads of the nations. Make it known, give praise, and say, ‘O Lord, save Your people. Save those who are left of Israel.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I am bringing them from the north country. And I will gather them from the farthest parts of the earth. Among them will be the blind and those who cannot walk, the woman with child and she who is giving birth, together. Many people will return here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will come crying, and in answer to their prayers, I will lead them. I will make them walk by rivers of waters on a straight path where they will not fall. For I am a father to Israel, and Ephraim is My first-born.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear the Word of the Lord, O nations, and make it known in the lands far across the sea. Say, “He Who sent Israel everywhere will gather them, and will watch over His flock like a shepherd.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord has paid the price to make Jacob free. He has made him free from the one who was stronger than he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will come and call out for joy on the height of Zion. They will shine with joy over the goodness of the Lord, over the grain, the new wine, and the oil, and over the young of the flock and the cattle. Their life will be like a well-watered garden. They will never have sorrow again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the young women who have never had a man will dance for joy, and the young men and old as well. For I will change their sorrow to joy, and will comfort them. I will give them joy for their sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will fill the soul of the religious leaders with more than they need. My people will be filled with My goodness,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord says, “The sound of crying and much sorrow is heard in Ramah. Rachel is crying for her children. She will not be comforted because they are dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord says, “Keep your voice from crying and your eyes from tears. For you will receive pay for your work,” says the Lord. “They will return from the land of those who hate them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is hope for your future,” says the Lord, “and your children will return to their own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have heard Ephraim crying in sorrow, ‘You have punished me, and I was punished, like a calf that has not learned. Bring me back that I may return to my place, for You are the Lord my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For after I turned back, I was sorry for my sins. And after I was taught, I hit my upper leg in sorrow. I was ashamed and troubled, because I suffered the shame from what I did when I was young.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is Ephraim My loved son? Is he the child of My joy? Yes, as many times as I have spoken against him, I still remember him. So My heart has a desire for him. For sure I will have loving-pity on him,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Set up marks on the road for yourself. Set up marks to lead you the right way. Remember the way you went, and return, O pure Israel. Return to your cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long will you go here and there, O daughter without faith? For the Lord has made a new thing on the earth: A woman will keep a man safe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord of All, the God of Israel, says, “When I bring them back to their own land, once again the people in the land of Judah and in its cities will speak these words: ‘May the Lord bring good to you, O place that is right with God, O holy hill!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Judah and all its cities will live there together, the farmer and they who go about with flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will help the tired ones and give strength to everyone who is weak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this I woke up and looked, and my sleep was pleasing to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, the days are coming,” says the Lord, “when I will plant the people of Israel and the people of Judah with the seed of man and the seed of animal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as I have watched over them to pull up, to break down, to take power away, to destroy, and to bring trouble, so I will watch over them to build and to plant,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In those days they will no longer say, ‘The fathers have eaten sour grapes, and the children got the sour taste.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But every one will die for his own sin. Each man who eats the sour grapes will get the sour taste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The days are coming,” says the Lord, “when I will make a New Way of Worship for the Jews and those of the family group of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The New Way of Worship will not be like the Old Way of Worship I gave to their early fathers. That was when I took them by the hand and led them out of Egypt. But they did not follow the Old Way of Worship, even when I was a husband to them,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the New Way of Worship that I will give to the Jews. When that day comes,” says the Lord, “I will put My Law into their minds. And I will write it on their hearts. I will be their God, and they will be My people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one will need to teach his neighbor or his brother to know the Lord. All of them will already know Me from the least to the greatest,” says the Lord. “I will forgive their sins. I will remember their sins no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord, the Lord of All is His name, Who gives the sun for light during the day, and put the moon and the stars in place to give light during the night, Who causes the waves of the sea to make a loud noise, says,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If these laws change before Me, then the children of Israel will stop being a nation before Me forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord says, “If one can find out how wide the heavens are, and look through the deepest places of the earth, then I will send all the children of Israel away from Me for all that they have done,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, the days are coming,” says the Lord, “when the city will be built again for the Lord from the tower of Hananel to the Corner Gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And its wall will go out farther, straight on to the hill of Gareb. Then it will turn to Goah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole valley of the dead bodies and of the ashes, and all the fields as far as the river Kidron, to the corner of the Horse Gate toward the east, will be holy to the Lord. It will never again be pulled up by the roots or destroyed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time the army of the king of Babylon was around Jerusalem. And Jeremiah the man of God was shut up in the open space of the prison, in the house of the king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For King Zedekiah of Judah had shut him up, saying, “Why do you speak these things in the Lord’s name? You have said, ‘This is what the Lord says: “I am giving this city to the king of Babylon, and he will take it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Zedekiah of Judah will not get away from the Babylonians. For sure he will be given into the hand of the king of Babylon. He will speak with him face to face and see him eye to eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will take Zedekiah to Babylon, and he will be there until I visit him,” says the Lord. “If you fight against the Babylonians, you will not win.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah said, “The Word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Hanamel, the son of your father’s brother Shallum, will come to you and say, “Buy my field at Anathoth. For because of your place in the family you have the right to buy it.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hanamel, the son of my father’s brother, came to me in the open space of the prison, as the Word of the Lord had said. And he said to me, ‘Buy my field at Anathoth in the land of Benjamin. For you have the right to own it. Because of your place in the family you have the right, so buy it for yourself.’ Then I knew that this was the Word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I bought the field at Anathoth from Hanamel, the son of my father’s brother. And I weighed out seventeen pieces of silver for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wrote my name and put my mark on the agreement, and called in people to watch. And I weighed the silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I took the agreement which showed that I had bought the field, both the agreement which was not to be opened, and the open one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I gave the written agreement to Baruch the son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah. This was seen by Hanamel, the son of my father’s brother, and by those who watched me write my name on the agreement, and by all the Jews who were sitting in the open space of the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I said to Baruch in front of them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord of All, the God of Israel, says: “Take these agreements, both the closed and open one, and put them in a clay jar so they may last a long time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord of All, the God of Israel, says, “Houses and fields and grape-fields will again be bought in this land.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After I had given the agreement showing I had bought the field to Baruch the son of Neriah, I prayed to the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘O Lord God! See, You have made the heavens and the earth by Your great power and by Your long arm! Nothing is too hard for You!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You show loving-kindness to thousands, but put punishment for the sins of fathers on their children after them. O great and powerful God, the Lord of All is Your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are great in wisdom and powerful in Your works. Your eyes are open to all the ways of men. You pay every one for what he does and for the fruit of what he does.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have made special things to see and have done wonders in the land of Egypt, and are still doing them even to this day both in Israel and among all men. You have made a name for Yourself as it is today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You brought Your people Israel out of the land of Egypt with special things to see and with wonders, and with a strong hand and a long arm, and with much trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And You gave them this land which You promised their fathers to give them, a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came in and took it for their own. But they did not obey Your voice or walk in Your Law. They did not do anything that You told them to do. So You have made all this trouble come upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, a battle-wall has been built up against the city to take it. And the city is given to the Babylonians who fight against it, because of the sword, hunger, and disease. What You have said would happen has now happened, as You see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord God, You have said to me, “Buy the field with money, and call in people to see you buy it,” even though the city will be given over to the Babylonians.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the Lord, the God of all flesh. Is anything too hard for Me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So this is what the Lord says: ‘See, I am giving this city to the Babylonians and to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he will take it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Babylonians who are fighting against this city will come into it and set this city on fire and burn it. And the houses will burn where people have given special perfume to Baal on their roofs and poured out drink gifts to other gods to make Me angry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the sons of Israel and the sons of Judah have been doing only what is sinful in My eyes since they were young. The sons of Israel have been only making Me angry by the work of their hands,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This city has made Me very angry since the day they built it until now. So I will put it away from before My face
verses.speaker: Narrator
